subject: Re: [junit] Test coverage metrics reporting tool
msgSnippet: The best way is to use a Profiler. See the JVMPI specification.  The problem with your approaches is that you can t be sure that every test will be executed.
messageBody:
The best way is to use a Profiler. See the JVMPI specification. The
problem with your approaches is that you can't be sure that every test
will be executed.

You can find some projects dealing with this issue but I haven't found
the one that fits my curiosity (would like to develop a real coverage
tool, with metrics and not tested code).

The project "SourceTrace" (Sourceforge prject) plans to write a JVMPI
profiler.

-Vladimir
